item.title: PHP logged in message
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

[quote=“X Entinity X, post:5, topic:432162”][quote author=ollie123 link=topic=534873.msg3911029#msg3911029 date=1328741099]
Except you would also have to call session_start() and use $_SESSION[‘logged_in’]
[/quote]
Well I automatically assume they’ve already done that[/quote]

I don’t think a ‘noob’ would know how…

item.title: PHP logged in message
item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:2, topic:432162”][quote author=X Entinity X link=topic=534873.msg3910387#msg3910387 date=1328663290]
For noobs at PHP who don’t know how to change certain words when a user is logged in.

Here you go.

<?php
if($session->logged_in){
echo("Text you want logged in users to see.");
}
else{
echo("Text you want guests to see.");
}
?>

[/quote]

Uhhh, what.[/quote]

This is the code you would put if you wanted logged in viewers to see a different message than not logged in users.

Read full topic
